description: Minor material amendment (s73) to vary Conditions 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 12, 15, 16, 17, 20, 34 and removal of duplicate condition 29 planning permission ref. 185616VAR dated 11/10/2019 for 'Redevelopment of the site to provide 139 flats and 479sqm commercial floor space accommodated within a part seven to nine storey residential building fronting onto the High Street with ground floor commercial use (retail, and/or financial/professional services, and/or restaurant/caf√© - flexible A1, A2 and A3 use classes)(Block A); and an adjoining part three to five storey residential building fronting onto Shrubbery Road (Block B); together with associated pedestrian through-access, disabled car parking, cycle storage, private and communal amenity spaces, refuse and recycling storage, and hard and soft landscaping'. Variation seeks to modify wording of conditions to consolidate all discharged condition details into a single decision notice.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall have begun before the expiration of three years from the 17th December 2018.

Reason: In order to ensure that this allocated site is brought forward for development as soon as practicable and to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) 404 B (10) P00 (Location Plan); 404 B (20) E00 (Existing Elevations); 0000 Rev 7 (Site Plan); 0100 Rev 13 (Ground Floor Plan); 0101 Rev 11 (First Floor Plan); 0102 Rev 10 (Second Floor Plan); 0103 Rev 11 (Third Floor Plan); 0104 Rev 11 (Fourth Floor Plan); 0105 Rev 11 (Fifth Floor Plan); 0106 Rev 11 (Sixth Floor Plan); 0107 Rev 11 (Seventh Floor Plan); 0108 Rev 11 (Eight Floor Plan); 0200 Rev 3 (South Elevation); 0201 Rev 3 (East Elevation); 0117 0207 (Inside North Elevation); 0203 Rev 3 (West Elevation);0205 Rev 3(North Elevation) ; as amended by drawing Nos. 0108 Rev. 14 (Eighth Floor Plan); 106 Rev. 13 (Sixth Floor Plan); 0107 Rev. 16 (Seventh Floor Plan); 0109 Rev. 03 (Roof Plan); 0100 Rev. 02 (Ground Floor Plan Waste Disposal); 0204 Rev. 04 (North Elevation); 0201 Rev. 03 (South Elevation) (all received: 14.03.2019); 0203 Rev. 01 (West Elevation) (received 04.12.2018); 0201 Rev. 04 (East Elevation); 0201 Rev. 03 (South Elevation); 0204 Rev. 04 (North Elevation)(all received 03.04.2019).

Planning Statement, prepared by CgMS (dated December 2017); Design and Access Statement - C, prepared by Create (dated November 2017); Affordable Housing Statement, prepared by CgMS (dated December 2017); Framework Delivery and Servicing Management Plan, prepared by Motion (dated 01/12/2017); Framework Residential Travel Plan, prepared by Motion (dated 01/12/2017); Transport Statement, prepared by Motion (dated 01/12/2017); Energy Statement Issue 6.1 (dated 25/11/2017) prepared by DK Partnership; Flood Risk and SUDS Statement, Drainage Assessment Form and Appendices, prepared by Don Bennett Consulting (dated December 2016) and SUDS Addendum ref. P17-102 49 High Street, Technical Note (dated November 2017) prepared by Rodgers Leask; Updated Proposal Scheme for the Former 'White Hart Public House', Southall, Archaeological Assessment (undated and author unknown); Geo-Environmental Desk Study / Preliminary Risk Assessment Report, prepared by Jomas Associates Limited (dated 15 November 2017); Daylight and Sunlight Assessment of Surrounding Dwellings, ref. A2809/DS/003, prepared by Accon UK (dated 05/07/2017) and Technical Note, prepared by Accon UK (dated 16/06/2017) and Sunlight and Daylight Statement, prepared by Point 2 Surveyors (dated November 2017); Ecological Assessment, prepared by Ecology Solutions (dated December 2017); as amended by Design and Access Statement Rev D, prepared by Create Design and Architecture (dated November 2018); Daylight and Sunlight Statement, prepared by Point 2 Surveyors Ltd (dated April 2019); as amended by Affordable Housing Statement on behalf of Home Group, prepared by GL Hearn (dated 23rd September 2020); and as amended by Planning Statement on behalf of Home Group, prepared by GL Hearn (dated 23rd September 2020)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Construction Method Statement and Management Plan approved under ref. 178930CND dated 03/09/2020. Any areas used for the storage of building materials or other site activities outside of the relevant phase of the development shall be returned to the original condition immediately following the practical completion of the development.

Reason:  To protect the amenity of local residents and to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies T4, T7, SI1 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); the National Planning Policy Framework (2012); Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006); and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise and vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.

| The development hereby shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the detailed surface water drainage design (including relevant specifications) and maintenance plan approved under ref. 190695CND dated 03/09/2020.

Reason: To prevent flooding elsewhere by ensuring that sufficient storage of surface flood water is provided and achieved with appropriate sustainable drainage techniques, in accordance policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); policy LV 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policy SI 13 of the London Plan (2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The materials used for the external surfaces of the development shall be Traditional Buff Brick : Kemsley Yellow - Wienerberger; Staffordshire slate blue brick smooth; aged copper curtain walls, with aluminium feature caps/mullions coated with Interpon D1036 SL843G RAL 7043 Matt HR; obscure glazed balustrades with aluminium capping powder coated with Interpon D1036 SL843G RAL 7043 Matt HR; and fibre cement boards coated with D1036 SA810G RAL 7040 Matt HR internal to balconies. These materials shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policy 2.10 of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012); policy D3 of the London Plan (2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications shall be carried out strictly in accordance with recommendations by Accon UK in their report ref. A3214/N/001 dated 16.11.2017 (and sound insulation including frames, seals and ventilators laboratory tested and approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 140-3: 1995 & BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and the details approved under ref. 190792CND dated 22/06/2020.
Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies D14 and D3 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| The sound insulation of floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings, namely living rooms/ kitchen adjacent/ above/ below bedroom of separate dwellings shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details approved under ref. 190697CND dated 02.08.2019.  These approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies D14 and D3 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| The sound insulation of the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating plant rooms/ lifts/ communal facilities from [dwellings] [noise sensitive premises] shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details approved under ref. 190700CND dated 17.07.2019. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies D14 and D3 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| The sound insulation of the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating the commercial part(s) of the premises from [dwellings] [noise sensitive premises] shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details approved under ref. 190701CND dated 17.07.2019. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies D14 and D3 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| The details and mitigation measures approved under ref. 190705CND dated 30/10/2020 shall be implemented prior to first use of plant/machinery/equipment and thereafter be permanently retained to prevent any adverse impact from plant and machinery on noise sensitive receivers in the surrounding area.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies D14 and D3 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| The commercial use shall not commence until all external doors to the commercial premises have been fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time shall any external door nor windows to commercial premises be fixed in an open position.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies D14 and D3 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| The development shall be strictly carried out in accordance with ventilation details approved under ref. 190707CND dated 22/06/2020. The ventilation system as approved shall be completed prior to first occupation and shall be maintained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To safeguard the amenity of future occupiers, in accordance with policy SI1 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1(e), of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and policy 5.21 of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013)

| Notwithstanding the submitted information, prior to the first use of the development hereby permitted, a detailed scheme of proposed hard and soft landscaping must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall include, but not limited to, the following details:

o	Full details of the two proposed roof top gardens (Blocks A and B) including planting and soft landscaping, hardscape, furniture and any other equipment including play equipment, and any balustrading. These details should be accompanied by plans, elevations, sections and a materials schedule/samples

o	Full details of the proposed courtyard garden on the ground floor including planting and soft landscaping, hardscape, furniture and any other equipment including children's play equipment, and boundary treatments. These details should be accompanied by plans, elevations, sections and a materials schedule/samples

o	Full details of the proposed hard and soft landscaping works for the proposed public realm/ widened 'School Passage', both within the site and on highways land. This shall include planting and soft landscaping, hardscape, furniture and any other equipment including planters. These details should be accompanied by plans, elevations, sections, a materials schedule/samples, and other relevant specifications

o	Full details of the proposed hard and soft landscaping and boundary treatment throughout the remainder of the site, including boundary treatments proposed for Shrubbery Road and the boundary treatment separating School Passage/public realm from the ground floor courtyard

The approved details shall be carried out prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development. The quality of all approved landscape works shall be in accordance with British Standard 4428:1989 'Code Of Practice For General Landscape Operations' or any subsequent revision. All trees included within the approved scheme shall be healthy, well-formed specimens with single leading shoots and shall be of a minimum quality compatible with British Standard 3936:1992 (Part 1) 'Specifications For Trees & Shrubs' and British Standard 4043 (where applicable) or any subsequent revisions.  Any trees which within a period of 5 years from the completion of all tree planting die, are removed, uprooted are significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed shall be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with others of the same size, species and quality as approved, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: In the interests of protecting and enhancing the visual amenities of the area and ensure appropriate tree planting in accordance with policies D3, D6, D8 and G5 of the London Plan (2021), and policies 5.10, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to occupation, details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development complies with the Air Quality Neutral Building Emissions Benchmark for the proposed residential use as stated in Appendix 5 of the Sustainable Design and Construction (2014) Supplementary Planning Guidance, London Plan.

Reason: To ensure that the building emissions from the development does not contribute to poor air quality to the detriment of future occupiers, neighbouring occuipiers and general public health, in accordance with policies SI 1, SI 2, SI 3 and SI 4 of the London Plan (2021), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and the GLA Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| The development shall incorporate the sustainability measures and details approved under ref. 190724CND dated 17.07.2019.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies SI 1, SI 2, SI 3, SI 4, SI 7, SI 13 and G5 of the London Plan (2021), policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, April 2014.

| The development shall implement the water efficiency measures approved under ref. 190725CND dated 17.07.2019 to ensure that the residential units will meet water efficiency standards with a maximum water use target of 105 litres of water per person per day.
Reason: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with policy SI 13 of the London Plan 2021.
| The development shall be carried out in accordance with the overheating mitigation and cooling measures and details approved under. Ref. 190729CND dated 17.07.2019.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to reduce the risk of overheating in line with policy SI 4 of the London Plan (2021), adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013).

| a)	Within three-months of the practical completion of each residential unit, Energy Performance Certificates and detailed modelling output reports for that component showing clearly the DER/TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

b)	Within three-months of the practical completion of each residential unit, evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

c)	 Prior to the final completion of all dwellings of the development, the approved dwellings shall incorporate measures, be designed to connect to an offsite CHP district heating network and achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 68.1% (equal to 104.76 tonnes CO2/year) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Statement Issue 6.1 (25 November 2017) prepared by DK Partnership:

i.	energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 22.02 tonnes CO2 equating to 14.3% CO2 emissions reduction in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 baseline

ii.	Connection to an offsite CHP district heating network to serve all dwellings within the development to achieve at least annual carbon emissions of 63.56 tonnes CO2 equating to 48% in regulated emissions savings over Be Lean stage

iii.	Incorporation of solar PV technology with a total capacity of 41.6kWp to provide c. 36.67MWh/yr of electricity and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 19.18 tonnes CO2 equating to 28.1% in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions reduction over the Be Clean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.

d)	Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be identified, incorporated and maintained in all dwellings.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

| a)	Within three-months of the practical completion of the commercial spaces, Energy Performance Certificates and detailed modelling output reports for that component showing clearly the BER/TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

b)	Within three-months of the practical completion of each non-residential unit evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

c)	Prior to the final completion of all commercial spaces of the development, the approved spaces shall incorporate measures, be designed to connect to an offsite CHP district heating network and achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 38.4% (equal to 10.32 tonnes CO2/year) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Statement Issue 6.1 (25 November 2017) prepared by DK Partnership:

i.	energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 2.89 tonnes CO2 equating to 10.7% CO2 emissions reduction in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 baseline

ii.	Connection to an offsite CHP district heating network to serve all commercial spaces within the development to achieve at least annual carbon emissions of 7.43 tonnes CO2 equating to 31% in regulated emissions savings over Be Lean stage

d)	Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be identified, incorporated and maintained in all commercial spaces.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

| The development shall be carried out and maintained in accordance with the energy centre and heat network details approved under ref. 190730CND dated 16/09/2020 and in accordance with Energy Strategy conditions 12 and 13 and S106 DHN clause.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
| The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Travel Plan approved under ref. 200257CND dated 09/10/2020.

Reason: To promote sustainable modes of transport, and to ensure that the development does not exacerbate congestion on the local road network, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies T2, T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021); and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG.

| The cycle parking shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details approved under ref. 200826CND dated 22/06/2020. The approved details shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(k) and (g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG, and The London Cycle Design Standards.

| Prior to the first residential use of the development hereby approved, two disabled vehicle parking spaces, at least one of which shall be provided with an active electric car charging point, shall be provided on-site and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of sufficient electric car charging points, and blue badge parking in accordance with policy T6 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.2(k) of Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and the adopted 'Sustainable Transport for New Development' supplementary planning document.

| The passenger lifts located within the communal cores serving the approved apartment block shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the apartment block to which the lift serves.

Reason: To ensure that adequate access is provided to all floors of the development for all occupiers and visitors including those with disabilities, in accordance with policies D5, D6 and D7 of the London Plan (2021); policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and interim Ealing SPG 'Accessible Ealing' (2012).

| Ninety percent of the approved residential dwellings shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(2)(Accessible and adaptable dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015, or other such relevant technical requirements in use at the time of the construction of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate to the changing needs of the future occupiers, in accordance with policies D5, D6 and D7 of the London Plan (2021); and policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012).

| Ten percent of the approved residential dwellings shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(3) (Wheelchair user dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015, or other such relevant technical standards in use at the time of the construction of the development.

Reason: To ensure the provision of wheelchair housing in a timely fashion that would address the current unmet housing need; produce a sustainable mix of accommodation; and provide an appropriate choice and housing opportunity for wheelchair users and their families, in accordance with the objectives of policies D5, D6 and D7 of the London Plan (2021); and policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012).

| The refuse and recycling storage provision and collection arrangements shall be provided prior to the first occupation of any dwelling or commercial unit to which the store(s) serves and retained thereafter.

Reason: To secure the necessary recycling and waste enclosures to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy SI 7 of the London Plan (2021); policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 7A, LV7.4 and 7B of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD (2013); and (interim) SPG 4: Refuse and Recyling Facilities.
| The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Delivery and Servicing Management Plan.

Reason: In the interests of highway safety and the amenities of neighbouring and prospective occupiers in accordance with policies T4, T7, SI1 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied :

a.	The first and second floor windows in the east-facing elevation of Block B serving flats 1.01 and 2.01 shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained for the life of the development; and

b.	Details shall be submitted of privacy screening for the east-facing elevation of the balconies serving flats 1.01 and 2.01 of Block B shall be submitted to the LPA for approval. The approved details shall be installed prior to occupation and shall be maintained for the life of the development.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties, in accordance with section 7 pf the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy D3 of London Plan (2021).

| The hours of business use for the ground floor flexible-use commercial units (A1 and/or A2 and/or A3 Use Classes) hereby approved shall be restricted to the period [0700 - 2300hrs] Monday to Sunday.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties and the prospective residential occupiers of the development in accordance with policies D14 and D3 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), the ground floor commercial units shall not be subdivided or amalgamated and shall only be used for A1, and/or A2, and/or A3 Use Class activities, and not for any other use.

Reason: To ensure that the Council retains control over the quality, impacts and provision of any change of use, and to safeguard the vitality and viability of the shopping and town centre in accordance with policies SD 6 and SD 10 of the London Plan (2021); policies 1.1(d), 2.7(c) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); and policy 4C of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to the occupation of any commercial units for restaurant or caf√© use (A3 use class), details and specifications of the ventilation duct including noise and vibration mitigation, odour abatement, and its siting and external appearance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation and retained for the duration of the use.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies SI1 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved contaminated land investigation, remediation scheme and verification report approved under ref. 190732CND dated 07/10/2020.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents and ensure that land contamination issues are addressed in accordance policy 5.21 of The Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policy SI 10 of the London Plan (2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
